property.name: templeton.port
property.description: The HTTP port for the main server.

property.name: templeton.hadoop.conf.dir
property.description: The path to the Hadoop configuration.

property.description: The path to the Templeton jar file.

property.name: templeton.libjars
property.description: Jars to add to the classpath.

property.name: templeton.override.jars
property.description: Jars to add the the HADOOP_CLASSPATH for all Map Reduce jobs. This is a list of jars that must exist on hdfs that are added to the Distributed Cache.

property.name: templeton.override.enabled
property.description: Enable the override path in templeton.override.jars

property.name: templeton.streaming.jar
property.description: The hdfs path to the Hadoop streaming jar file.

property.name: templeton.hadoop
property.description: The path to the Hadoop executable.

property.name: templeton.pig.archive
property.description: The path to the Pig archive.

property.name: templeton.pig.path
property.description: The path to the Pig executable.

property.name: templeton.hcat
property.description: The path to the hcatalog executable.

property.name: templeton.hive.archive
property.description: The path to the Hive archive.

property.name: templeton.hive.path
property.description: The path to the Hive executable.

property.name: templeton.hive.properties
property.description: Properties to set when running hive.

property.name: templeton.exec.encoding
property.description: The encoding of the stdout and stderr data.

property.name: templeton.exec.timeout
property.description: How long in milliseconds a program is allowed to run on the Templeton box.

property.name: templeton.exec.max-procs
property.description: The maximum number of processes allowed to run at once.

property.name: templeton.exec.max-output-bytes
property.description: The maximum number of bytes from stdout or stderr stored in ram.

property.name: templeton.controller.mr.child.opts
property.description: Java options to be passed to templeton controller map task. The default value of mapreduce child "-Xmx" (heap memory limit) might be close to what is allowed for a map task. Even if templeton controller map task does not need much memory, the jvm (with -server option?) allocates the max memory when it starts. This along with the memory used by pig/hive client it starts can end up exceeding the max memory configured to be allowed for a map task Use this option to set -Xmx to lower value

property.name: templeton.exec.envs
property.description: The environment variables passed through to exec.

property.name: templeton.zookeeper.hosts
property.description: ZooKeeper servers, as comma separated host:port pairs

property.name: templeton.zookeeper.session-timeout
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout in milliseconds

property.name: templeton.callback.retry.interval
property.description: How long to wait between callback retry attempts in milliseconds

property.name: templeton.callback.retry.attempts
property.description: How many times to retry the callback

property.name: templeton.storage.class
property.description: The class to use as storage

property.name: templeton.storage.root
property.description: The path to the directory to use for storage

property.name: templeton.hdfs.cleanup.interval

property.description: The maximum delay between a thread's cleanup checks

property.name: templeton.zookeeper.cleanup.maxage
property.description: The maximum age of a templeton job
